Contributor.Organization: Vaccine Research Institute of San Diego

Sample.Title: corA mutant array 1 subarray 1

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB with antibiotics at 37°C with shaking, subcultured into LB without antibiotics and grown to log phase at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted using a GenElute kit (Sigma )
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 1.5 μg of genomic DNA, 3.3 ul random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), and bring to 39 μl with DI water. 2. Mix well and incubate at 100°C for 12 min. 3. Snap-freeze in dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 4. Mix: 39 μl of above genomic DNA/primer mix, 5 μl of 10X EcoPol (Klenow) buffer (included with New England Biolabs #M0212L), 2 μl of 5 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 4 μl DNA Polymerase I Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs #M0212L). 5. Mix and incubate at 37°C overnight. 6. Stop reaction by adding 5 μl of 0.5 M EDTA (pH 8.0). Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously in large glass dish for 2-3 min. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Name: CH1_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of corA mutant's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Column.Name: CH2_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy5 labeled genomic DNA (CH2)

Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously in large glass dish for 2-3 min. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker Do not let slides dry out during washing process. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Description: intensity of corA mutant's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Column.Name: CH2_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy5 labeled genomic DNA (CH2)

Sample.Title: corA mutant array 2 subarray 1

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB with antibiotics at 37°C with shaking, subcultured into LB without antibiotics and grown to log phase at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted using a GenElute kit (Sigma )
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 1.5 μg of genomic DNA, 3.3 ul random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), and bring to 39 μl with DI water. 2. Mix well and incubate at 100°C for 12 min. 3. Snap-freeze in dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 4. Mix: 39 μl of above genomic DNA/primer mix, 5 μl of 10X EcoPol (Klenow) buffer (included with New England Biolabs #M0212L), 2 μl of 5 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 4 μl DNA Polymerase I Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs #M0212L). 5. Mix and incubate at 37°C overnight. 6. Stop reaction by adding 5 μl of 0.5 M EDTA (pH 8.0). Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously (move back and forth by hand quickly) in large glass dish for 2-3 min. The most important wash is the first wash, because that is when most of the excess dye comes off. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker or by hand on the benchtop mimicking an orbital shaker. Do not use DTT in wash buffers. Slightly old DTT will cause green film on slide, thus ruining the slide. Do not use ddH20 for wash buffers. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. Washing is very important to remove excess dye and decrease background. Extra washes will help remove excess dye and reduce background. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Name: CH1_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of corA mutant's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Column.Name: CH2_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy5 labeled genomic DNA (CH2)

Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously (move back and forth by hand quickly) in large glass dish for 2-3 min. The most important wash is the first wash, because that is when most of the excess dye comes off. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker or by hand on the benchtop mimicking an orbital shaker. Do not use DTT in wash buffers. Slightly old DTT will cause green film on slide, thus ruining the slide. Do not use ddH20 for wash buffers. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. Washing is very important to remove excess dye and decrease background. Extra washes will help remove excess dye and reduce background. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Sample.Title: corA mutant array 3 subarray 3

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB with antibiotics at 37°C with shaking, subcultured into LB without antibiotics and grown to log phase at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted using a GenElute kit (Sigma )
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 1.5 μg of genomic DNA, 3.3 ul random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), and bring to 39 μl with DI water. 2. Mix well and incubate at 100°C for 12 min. 3. Snap-freeze in dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 4. Mix: 39 μl of above genomic DNA/primer mix, 5 μl of 10X EcoPol (Klenow) buffer (included with New England Biolabs #M0212L), 2 μl of 5 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 4 μl DNA Polymerase I Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs #M0212L). 5. Mix and incubate at 37°C overnight. 6. Stop reaction by adding 5 μl of 0.5 M EDTA (pH 8.0). Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously (move back and forth by hand quickly) in large glass dish for 2-3 min. The most important wash is the first wash, because that is when most of the excess dye comes off. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker or by hand on the benchtop mimicking an orbital shaker. Do not use DTT in wash buffers. Slightly old DTT will cause green film on slide, thus ruining the slide. Do not use ddH20 for wash buffers. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. Washing is very important to remove excess dye and decrease background. Extra washes will help remove excess dye and reduce background. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Name: CH1_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Column.Name: CH2_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy5 labeled genomic DNA (CH2)

Mix: 39 μl of above genomic DNA/primer mix, 5 μl of 10X EcoPol (Klenow) buffer (included with New England Biolabs #M0212L), 2 μl of 5 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 4 μl DNA Polymerase I Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs #M0212L). 5. Mix and incubate at 37°C overnight. 6. Stop reaction by adding 5 μl of 0.5 M EDTA (pH 8.0). Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously (move back and forth by hand quickly) in large glass dish for 2-3 min. The most important wash is the first wash, because that is when most of the excess dye comes off. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker or by hand on the benchtop mimicking an orbital shaker. Do not use DTT in wash buffers. Slightly old DTT will cause green film on slide, thus ruining the slide. Do not use ddH20 for wash buffers. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. Washing is very important to remove excess dye and decrease background. Extra washes will help remove excess dye and reduce background. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Name: CH1_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Column.Name: CH2_SIG_MEAN
Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy5 labeled genomic DNA (CH2)

Sample.Title: wild type array 2 subarray 2

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking, subcultured into LB and grown to log phase at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.

Column.Description: intensity of wild type's Cy3 labeled cDNA (CH1)

Sample.Title: wild type array 3 subarray 1

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking, subcultured into LB and grown to log phase at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Hot phenol/chloroform extract of total RNA: 1. Place 25.0 ml of phenol (Sigma, P4682-400mL) into a glass bottle, cap bottle loosely. Never use ddH20, only use DI water for all array protocols. 2. Place bottle of phenol in boiling water 100°C. 3. Heat phenol for approximately 10 minutes prior to extraction. 4. Transfer 25.0 ml of a bacterial culture into the hot phenol. 5. Shake to mix the phases. 6. Loosen cap every so often to release gas build up. 7. Heat for about 15-30 minutes. The mixture should look like one layer, not two. 8. Transfer mixtures into two “RNase-treated” centrifuge tubes (Ambion). 9. Place tubes on ice. 10. Add 5.0 ml of chloroform to each tube. 11. Mix thoroughly and release gas build up. 12. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 13. Transfer aqueous phases (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. Instead, leave 1-3 mls of the aqueous layer behind. 14. Add 6.25 ml of phenol to each tube. 15. Add 6.25 ml of chloroform to each tube. 16. Shake to mix and release gas build up. 17. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 10 minutes. 18. Transfer each aqueous phase (top layer) to a fresh centrifuge tube. Be careful not to get bottom layer of debris; this will ruin the quality of the RNA. 19. Add 0.1 volume of 3.0 M sodium acetate in DEPC (diethylpyrocarbonate) treated water (Ambion) to each of the tubes. 20. Add an equal volume of isopropanol to each tube. 21. Cool on ice for 30 minutes. Longer incubations do not increase RNA yield. 22. Spin at 10,000 g at 4°C for 60 minutes. Longer spins will increase RNA yield. 21. Remove all of the supernatant, pat inverted tubes onto paper towels to remove excess supernatant being careful not to contaminate RNA or lose RNA pellet, then allow the pellet to air dry upright in uncapped tubes for 5 minutes in the fume hood. 23. Resuspend the pellet in RNase free water containing 200 U/ml RNaseOUT (Invitrogen).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 30 μg of total RNA, 2 μl random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), 1 μl RNaseOUT (Invitrogen #10777-019), and bring to 18.5 μl with DEPC water. 2. For RNA labeling, mix well, incubate at 70°C for 10 min, snap freeze in a dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 3. Mix the following: 18.5 μl of RNA/primer mix from above step, 6 μl 5X first strand buffer (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 3 μl 0.1 M DTT (included with Invitrogen #18080-044), 0.6 μl 25 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 2.0 μl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200U/μl) (Invitrogen #18080-044). 4. Mix and incubate in a 42°C water bath overnight. 5. Hydrolyze RNA strand by adding 10 μl of 0.5 M EDTA and 10 μl of 1.0 M NaOH 6. Mix and incubate at 65°C for 15 minutes. 7. Add 25 μl of 1.0 M Tris (pH 7.0) to neutralize pH. Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy3 (Amersham Biosciences #PA23001) 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown overnight in LB at 37°C with shaking.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted using a GenElute kit (Sigma )
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Part 1: 1. Using RNase free tubes, mix: 1.5 μg of genomic DNA, 3.3 ul random hexamers (3 mg/ml) (Invitrogen #48190-011), and bring to 39 μl with DI water. 2. Mix well and incubate at 100°C for 12 min. 3. Snap-freeze in dry ice/ethanol bath for 30 sec, centrifuge briefly, and bring to room temperature. 4. Mix: 39 μl of above genomic DNA/primer mix, 5 μl of 10X EcoPol (Klenow) buffer (included with New England Biolabs #M0212L), 2 μl of 5 mM dNTP’s (Invitrogen #10297-018)/aa-dUTP (2:3 aa-dUTP (Ambion #8439) to dTTP) labeling mix, and 4 μl DNA Polymerase I Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs #M0212L). 5. Mix and incubate at 37°C overnight. 6. Stop reaction by adding 5 μl of 0.5 M EDTA (pH 8.0). Part 2: 1. Clean-up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns (Qiagen #28004). 2. Mix each reaction with 400 μl of PB buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and transfer to MinElute columns. 3. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min and discard flow through. 4. Wash with 750 μl of phosphate wash buffer (5 mM KPO4 pH 8.0 and 80% ethanol) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 minute. 5. Discard flow through and centrifuge an additional minute at 13,000 rpm. 6. Transfer column to a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and add 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer (4 mM KPO4 pH 8.5). 7. Let sit at room temperature for 1 min and centrifuge for 1 min at 13,000 rpm. 8. Add another 30 μl of phosphate elution buffer and repeat elution step 7. 9. Transfer open tubes to speed vac and dry on high heat for about 20-30 min. 10. Let 4.5 μl of 0.1 M sodium carbonate buffer pH 9.3 (made fresh) sit on pellet for 10-15 minutes. Resuspend by pipeting slowly for 2-3 minutes. 11. Add 4.5 μl Cy5 dye (Amersham Biosciences #PA25001). 12. Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 2 hr. 13. Clean up reactions using Qiagen MinElute columns. 14. Mix samples with 250 μl of PB buffer and transfer to MinElute column. 15. Centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min, and discard flow through. 16. Wash with 750 μl of PE buffer (included in Qiagen #28004) and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 17. Discard flow through, and transfer to a new 1.5 microfuge tube and add 50 μl of DI water. 18. Let samples sit at room temperature for 1 min and spin at 13,000 rpm for 1 min. 19. Add another 50 μl of DI water and repeat elution step 18. 20. Mix labeled probes and dry down in speed vac on high heat for about 30-40 minutes.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Prepping slides for hybridization: 1. Warm up slide pre-hybridiztion solution (25% formamide, 5X SSC (Ambion #9763), 0.1% SDS, 0.1 mg/ml BSA) to 42°C in a Coplin jar (VWR# 25457-200) in a water bath. 2. Incubate microarray slides in pre-warmed hybridization solution for 60 min at 42°C. 3. Wash arrays 10X in glass Wheaton dishes (Wheaton Science Products #900200) with DI water. 4. Wash arrays 1X with isopropanol. 5. Dry arrays by centrifugation at 1000 rpm for 15-20 min. 6. Make hybridization buffer: 250 μl of formamide, 250 μl of 20X SSC, 490 μl of DI water, and add 10 μl 10% SDS last. Filter hybridization buffer with a 0.45 μm filter. 7. Heat probe at 95°C on heat block for 5-10 min and vortex to resuspend. 8. Warm up hybridization chambers (Corning #2551) with slides inside on heat block. 9. Add hot probe to center of hot slide. Hold cover slip at 45° angle close to slide surface and drop. Add hybridization buffer to the bottom of the chamber to keep it humidified. 10. Close up chambers, cover with foil, weigh down in 42°C water bath, and incubate overnight. Post-Hybridization and scanning: 1. Remove cover slips by holding slides upside down in warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in a large glass dish. Remove fallen cover slip and wash slides vigorously (move back and forth by hand quickly) in large glass dish for 2-3 min. The most important wash is the first wash, because that is when most of the excess dye comes off. Then wash 2 times for 5 min with warm (55°C) low stringency buffer (2X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20) in Wheaton dish on an orbital shaker or by hand on the benchtop mimicking an orbital shaker. Do not use DTT in wash buffers. Slightly old DTT will cause green film on slide, thus ruining the slide. Do not use ddH20 for wash buffers. Do not let slides dry out during washing process. Washing is very important to remove excess dye and decrease background. Extra washes will help remove excess dye and reduce background. 2. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature medium stringency buffer (0.1X SSC and 0.1% SDS in dH20). 3. Wash slides vigorously 2 times for 5 min with room temperature high stringency buffer (0.1X SSC in dH20). 4. Wash slides in water 1 time for 3 min and transfer to centrifuge. 5. Dry slides by centrifugation for 15-20 min at 1000 rpm. 6. Slides should be kept in the dark until they are scanned.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned using a GenePix 4000B microarray scanner. Slides should be scanned to obtain a ratio between 0.8-1.2 for Cy3/Cy5 fluorescence.
Sample.Description: CorA is the primary Mg2+ channel in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium. Cells were collected for RNA isolation on three separate days from wild type or corA strains giving six total samples from three independent cultures for each strain. Genomic DNA from wild type was used as a reference on each slide.
Sample.Data-Processing: The TM4 Microarray Suite produced by TIGR was used for data analysis (Saeed AI, 2003, Biotechniques). Spotfinder was used to assign gene identifiers to spots (circle algorithm) and to flag spots. MIDAS was used to normalize (Lowess (Locfit) and Standard Deviation Regularization) the data. The normalized data was imported into Microsoft Excel. Normalized intensity values for RNA were divided by those for the genomic DNA control for each slide to obtain a ratio. Three sets of ratios were obtained for wild type and three sets of ratios were obtained for a corA strain.
